{
  "Allegations" : "ALLEGED WAS NOT AWARE HER CD WAS A LONG TERM CD; MISREPRESENTATION & OMISSION OF MATERIAL FACTS; NEGLIGENCE & COMMON LAW FRAUD. ALLEGED DAMAGES IN EXCESS OF $15,000.  *** ORIGINALLY IN JANUARY 1999, [CUSTOMER] CALLED ME FROM A PUBLISHED NEWSPAPER AD FEATURING LONG TERM CDS WITH MATURITIES OF 12/30/2013 AND 1/11/2019 RESPECTIVELY.  AFTER DISCUSSING THE FEATURES OF THE CDS, SHE APPROVED THE TRADE ON 1/4/1999 FOR A $65,000, 1/22/2019 MATURITY CD.  SIX WEEKS LATER ON 2/18/1999, SHE APPROVED THE TRADE OF A SECOND CD FOR $99,000 MATURING IN 3/3/2009.  PRIOR TO BOTH PURCHASES, [CUSTOMER] RECEIVED VERBAL DISCLOSURES (INCLUDING PRINCIPAL FLUCTUATIONS) AND WRITTEN DISCLOSURE DOCUMENTS(INCLUDING PRINCIPAL FLUCUTATIONS) AND CONFIRMATIONS FROM A.G. EDWARDS.  FROM JANUARY 1999 THROUGH APRIL 2000, [CUSTOMER] RECEIVED OVER 85 ENTRIES ON MONTHLY STATEMENTS AND CONFIRMATIONS LISITNG THE MATURITIES OF THE CDS AND NEVER COMPLAINED.  AT THE TIME [CUSTOMER] PURCHASED BOTH CDS, A.G. EDWARDS PRICED ALL CDS ON STATEMENT AT PAR, OR FACE VALUE.  BEGINNING IN MAY 2000, A.G. EDAWRDS BEGAN SHOWING ESTIMATED FAIR MAKET VALUE OF CDS.  BECAUSE INTEREST RATES HAD INCREASED, [CUSTOMER'S] CD VALUES HAD TEMPORARILY DECLINED AND SHE BECAME UPSET.  SHE FORGOT OUR INITIAL DISCUSSION REGARDING MARKET FLUCTUATIONS AND BEGAN MAKING FALSE ALLEGATIONS.  AFTER REVIEWING HER COMPLAINT, A.G. EDWARDS DENIED COMPENSATION AND SHE LATER FOUND LEGAL CONSEL.  [CUSTOMER] LATER DISMISSED ME BUT SETTLED WITH A.G. EDAWRDS FOR $25,739, WHICH INCLUDED SEVERAL THOUSAND DOLLARS IN ATTORNEY'S FEE.",
